00040 static IEventManager * g_pEventMgr = NULL;
00041 
00042 IEventManager * IEventManager::Get()
00043 {
00044         return g_pEventMgr;
00045 }
00046 
00047 IEventManager::IEventManager(
00048         char const * const pName,
00049         bool setAsGlobal )
00050 {
00051         if ( setAsGlobal )
00052                 g_pEventMgr = this;
00053 }
00054 
00055 IEventManager::~IEventManager()
00056 {
00057         if ( g_pEventMgr == this )
00058                 g_pEventMgr = NULL;
00059 }

00061 //--
00062 //
00063 // EventType::hash_name         - Chapter 11, page 345
00064 //
00065 void *
00066 EventType::hash_name( char const * pIdentStr )
00067 {
00068         // Relatively simple hash of arbitrary text string into a
00069         // 32-bit identifier Output value is
00070         // input-valid-deterministic, but no guarantees are made
00071         // about the uniqueness of the output per-input
00072         //
00073         // Input value is treated as lower-case to cut down on false
00074         // separations cause by human mistypes. Sure, it could be
00075         // construed as a programming error to mix up your cases, and
00076         // it cuts down on permutations, but in Real World Usage
00077         // making this text case-sensitive will likely just lead to
00078         // Pain and Suffering.
00079         //
00080         // This code lossely based upon the adler32 checksum by Mark
00081         // Adler and published as part of the zlib compression
00082         // library sources.
00083 
00084         // largest prime smaller than 65536
00085         unsigned long BASE = 65521L;
00086 
00087         // NMAX is the largest n such that 255n(n+1)/2 +
00088         // (n+1)(BASE-1) <= 2^32-1
00089         unsigned long NMAX = 5552;
00090 
00091 #define DO1(buf,i)  {s1 += tolower(buf[i]); s2 += s1;}
00092 #define DO2(buf,i)  DO1(buf,i); DO1(buf,i+1);
00093 #define DO4(buf,i)  DO2(buf,i); DO2(buf,i+2);
00094 #define DO8(buf,i)  DO4(buf,i); DO4(buf,i+4);
00095 #define DO16(buf)   DO8(buf,0); DO8(buf,8);
00096 
00097     if (pIdentStr == NULL)
00098                 return NULL;
00099 
00100         if ( strcmp( pIdentStr, kpWildcardEventType ) == 0 )
00101                 return 0;
00102         
00103     unsigned long s1 = 0;
00104     unsigned long s2 = 0;
00105 
00106         for ( size_t len = strlen( pIdentStr ); len > 0 ; )
00107         {
00108         unsigned long k = len < NMAX ? len : NMAX;
00109 
00110                 len -= k;
00111 
00112                 while (k >= 16)
00113                 {
00114             DO16(pIdentStr);
00115                         pIdentStr += 16;
00116             k -= 16;
00117         }
00118                 
00119         if (k != 0) do
00120                 {
00121             s1 += *pIdentStr++;
00122                         s2 += s1;
00123         } while (--k);
00124                 
00125         s1 %= BASE;
00126         s2 %= BASE;
00127     }
00128 
00129 #pragma warning(push)
00130 #pragma warning(disable : 4312)
00131 
00132     return reinterpret_cast<void *>( (s2 << 16) | s1 );
00133 
00134 #pragma warning(pop)
00135 #undef DO1
00136 #undef DO2
00137 #undef DO4
00138 #undef DO8
00139 #undef DO16
00140 }

00144 // lastly, some macros that make it less difficult to safely use
00145 // a possibly not-ready system ...
00146 
00147 bool safeAddListener( EventListenerPtr const & inHandler, EventType const & inType )
00148 {
00149         assert(IEventManager::Get() && _T("No event manager!"));
00150         return IEventManager::Get()->addListener( inHandler, inType );
00151 }
00152 
00153 bool safeDelListener( EventListenerPtr const & inHandler, EventType const & inType )
00154 {
00155         assert(IEventManager::Get() && _T("No event manager!"));
00156         return IEventManager::Get()->delListener( inHandler, inType );
00157 }
00158 
00159 bool safeTriggerEvent( Event const & inEvent )
00160 {
00161         assert(IEventManager::Get() && _T("No event manager!"));
00162         return IEventManager::Get()->trigger( inEvent );
00163 }
00164 
00165 bool safeQueEvent( EventPtr const & inEvent )
00166 {
00167         assert(IEventManager::Get() && _T("No event manager!"));
00168         return IEventManager::Get()->queueEvent( inEvent );
00169 }
00170 
00171 bool safeAbortEvent( EventType const & inType,
00172                                          bool allOfType /*= false*/ )
00173 {
00174         assert(IEventManager::Get() && _T("No event manager!"));
00175         return IEventManager::Get()->abortEvent( inType, allOfType );
00176 }
00177 
00178 bool safeTickEventManager( unsigned long maxMillis /*= kINFINITE*/ )
00179 {
00180         assert(IEventManager::Get() && _T("No event manager!"));
00181         return IEventManager::Get()->tick( maxMillis );
00182 }
00183 
00184 bool safeValidateEventType( EventType const & inType )
00185 {
00186         assert(IEventManager::Get() && _T("No event manager!"));
00187         return IEventManager::Get()->validateType( inType );
00188 }
